question: Can You Describe the Steps Involved in Software Development?
answer:
Short anwser
  • Planning & Requirement gathering
  • Timeframes, Tools and team if applicable
  • Design
  • Iterate
  • Implementation of code
  • Testing
  • Deployment


  • Initial planning and brainstorming is the first step in software development. I would take part in the working out of the purpose/functionality required.
  • Next, involves team analysis, including the time frame and which tools and team members are needed if not working lone.
  • Then comes the design stage, where a program is designed by a team of software engineers/UI Designers before moving on to the development stage.
  • Once in development, I step in to transform the design into functional software.
  • It's then off to quality assurance to identify any defects or bugs.
  • Lastly, the software is officially installed and deployed using a planned CI/CD strategy.

question: Can You Differentiate Between Functional and Object-Oriented Programming?
answer: • Functional programming relies on mathematical functions, whereas object-oriented programming relies on classes of objects closely associated with functions. When using functional programming, you must work solely with functions. Object-oriented programming, on the other hand, allows you to store functions/methods within objects.

question: How do you build for accessibility?
answer:
Implement the following
  • Try to meet WCAG 2.0, and ARIA 1.2, and pass axe and Lighthouse accessibility audits
  • Test during development using axe DevTools and lighthouse
  • Fix low-color contrast issues
  • Use semantic HTML
  • Add ARIA support for screen readers
  • Angular CDK a11y package

question: What steps do you take to mitigate preformance issues in Angular Application
answer:
Implement the following
  • OnPush change detection strategy : we can tell Angular not to check each component, every time the change detection runs.
  • Detach Change Detection/NgZone :This technique can save a lot of time and improves performance for the objects where we don't need to check for changes every time some change occurs.
  • Pure Pipes
  • Lazy Loading Modules - Preloading Modules
  • AOT Compilation (default since Angular 9)
  • more yes...

Implement the following
  • Webkit bundle Analyzer to help optimize your odules and see if there are any issues or stuff your not using.
